About me

Hi! This is a blog that I'm using to capture some of my work as a Data Developer, as well as some thoughts on more generic topics.

My background is in environmental science and remote sensing - I read Geography as an undergraduate at Swansea University and then studied for an MSc By Research in Glaciology, focussing on the the detection of surface change processes on Arctic ice-caps using Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR). I’ve also worked extensively in the public sector (mainly local government) focusing on the use of data to improve services.

I now work as a Data Developer for Nesta, using data from across the data spectrum to help inform innovation policy across Wales.

Current Projects

Here’s a list of projects i’m currently working on:

  • Development of an innovation dashboard for Wales (Arloesiadur) using new and novel data.

Have questions or suggestions? Feel free to open an issue on GitHub or ask me on Twitter.

Thanks for reading!
